Open, :bow:: Put a target Armor or Weapon in your discard pile into your hand. Destroy this Holding.
title: Delicate Forge

flavor: Though the conflict between the heirs brewed, the Otomo refused to note it in any of their scrolls. This struggle would never exist in Rokugani history.
designernotes: A humorless and bored looking Otomo Imperial official.

text:
:bow:: Produce 5 Gold.
Political Tireless Interrupt: Choose an Honor gain or loss from another player's action and reduce it to 2.
title: Otomo Bureaucrat

flavor: The stench of despair never leaves this place. Men walk quickly to leave it behind, yet the temptations lay their hooks deeply within any passersby.
designernotes: Adrian, you can ignore the title. This is some sort of corrupted Holding.

text:
After you Recruit this Holding, lose 1 Honor.
:bow:: Produce 2 Gold and lose 1 Honor.
title: Lane of Immorality

flavor: Only the devout ever visit this building. Some say the spirits are pleased by and reward the extra effort given by the visitors. Others say that is a rumor started by the head priest…
designernotes: A small temple hidden in the mountains.

text:
:bow:: Produce 1 Gold.
Open, :bow:: Search your Fate deck for a Ring. Show it. Put it into your hand. Discard a card. Destroy this Holding.
title: Remote Temple

flavor: The Colonies once hosted hundreds of temples to foreign gods. Ones to the Kami were built shortly after the arrival of the samurai, and some of those shrines now rivaled their counterparts on the mainland.
designernotes: A small shrine deep in the Phoenix lands.

text:
Reduce all Honor losses from your cards by 1, to a minimum of 1.
:bow:: Produce 2 Gold.
title: Shrine of the Colonies

flavor: The fiercest struggles of the Emerald Empire seem small when one stands within the serenity of the temple grounds.
designernotes: A temple courtyard, with monks meditating.

text:
:bow:: Produce 3 Gold.
Tireless Open: Discard a Kiho or a Spell to straighten this Holding. (Tireless actions may be taken even while bowed.)
title: Contemplative Shrine

flavor: "Try to remain still, brother. The kami will heal you, if you let them."
designernotes: Art: The inside of a medical building, with a bunch of injured Samurai being tended to by Shugenja/healers.

text:
(Draw a card after your Expendable card is destroyed. Fortifications attach, bowed, to the Province from which they entered play.)
Tireless Interrupt: Negate all the action's Melee and Ranged Attacks (at this battlefield).
title: Blessed Herbalist

flavor: "No, I didn't hear anything! Stop trying to distract me! I am on a lucky streak!"
designernotes: Group of rugged samurai huddled on a wall, playing a dice game.

text:
(Fortifications attach, bowed, to the Province from which they entered play.)
Before this Province is destroyed, transfer this Holding to an adjacent Province.
Tireless Open: Straighten this Holding. It will not produce Gold until after your next turn begins.
title: Distracted Sentries

flavor: Most temples established by shugenja are aligned to one element over the other, purely due to the priests' preferences.

text: Battle, :bow:, :g*:: Equip a target Spell to your target opposed, unbowed Shugenja, paying 2 less Gold. If he and the Spell share an element or Thunder keyword, you may take an additional action from the Spell.
title: Elemental Library

flavor: The mapmaker gaped as he cleared the pass. "How long has this been here?" he wondered.
designernotes: An ancient, overgrown temple where a shugenja discovers secret knowledge.

text:
(Once per turn as a Dynasty, remove a card in your hand from the game to search your deck and Provinces for a Legacy Holding and Recruit it.)
You must have at least 16 Holdings in your deck construction.
title: Forgotten Legacy

flavor: "We may only be here a month," the commander said, "but I won't have our horses wandering. Fences, men. Defensive and containment."

text: Battle, :bow:, :g*:: Equip a target Follower or Spell in your discard pile if another player's action destroyed it or its Personality this battle.
title: Forward Encampment

flavor: "If there is ever a chance it will be attacked, do yourself a favor and commission a Kaiu." - Common saying among governors
designernotes: Tall walls that give you protection and allow you to shoot down from.

text:
This Holding enters play unbowed.
Interrupt, :bow:: Negate an Engage action.
Battle, :bow:: Ranged 3 Attack.
title: Kaiu-Built Defenses

flavor: "Celebration or not, this trench must be dug. Do you relish the thought of cavalry overrunning the village? No? Then dig!"
designernotes: Art: A Kaiu directing the operation of a large device used to dig trenches. A finished trench should be detailed enough within the art so we can use it for a token.

text:
(Fortifications attach, bowed, to the Province from which they entered play.)
Interrupt, :bow:: Negate the movement into an attacking army of a target Personality at any location.
title: Labor Crew

flavor: "Oh, I see you brought a no-dachi. That is so quaint. No, I certainly never have seen that before."
designernotes: An intimidating Samurai looming over a cowering opponent in a training dojo.

text: Tireless Interrupt: If you have won a duel this turn, each of the action's Fear effects have +1 strength and may target Items and Spells. (Tireless actions may be taken even while bowed.)
title: Personal Dojo

flavor:
"It is a beauty, yes? Caught on the day of the Empress's proclamation! They were jumping into the boat!"
"My profits have been down at the inn lately. How much for the ones that stopped jumping longer ago?"

text: Invest :g2:: Give this Holding two +1GP Wealth tokens. (Entering play, permanently increase the Gold Cost by the Invest cost to get the effect.)
title: Questionable Market

flavor:
"I always thought this was a tax warehouse," she commented.
Behind the blindfold, he smiled. "Let us begin."

text: Interrupt, :bow:: Bow the winner of any duel created by the action if he was the challenger. Destroy this Holding.
title: Secret Dojo

flavor: Destiny is an idea that everyone accepts, but which few truly understand. Those few who dedicate themselves to unraveling its mysteries are often lost to others.
designernotes: A bustling port town.

text: (Draw a card after you Recruit a Destined card.)
title: Temple of Destiny

flavor: "If the other clans think us only what we appear to be, they are fools." - Daigotsu Kanpeki
designernotes: A modest, dark Dojo  with Spider banners, an instructor is ferociously attacking a young Spider. They have black blades.

text: Interrupt, :bow:: If the action creates a duel, then after your Personality wins it permanently give him the ability, "Battle: Fear 4 (Bow a target enemy Follower or Personality without Followers with 4 or lower Force)." Destroy this Holding.
title: The Obsidian Dojo

flavor: "The Mad Dragon will return one day!" He laughed. "The faithful will be ready!"

text:
Open, :bow:: Straighten your target Personality. Destroy this Holding.
Open, :bow:: Straighten this Holding if you have not given any Madness tokens this turn. Give a target Personality a Madness token.
title: Throes of Madness

flavor:
"The tower will look better there."
"...Overlooking the woods?"
designernotes: Art: An oddly dressed man discussing blueprints with a Kaiu. In the background many workers are busily working to construct the building pictured.

text:
(Fortifications attach to the Province from which they entered play.)
If you use this Holding's Gold Production to Recruit a single Fortification only, you choose which of your Provinces the Fortification attaches to.
title: Architect

flavor: Sometimes, isolated farming communities start to prefer self-governance to the leadership of samurai. That they do not understand the ways of their lords does not help matters.
designernotes: [Note: Armed Ashigaru patrolling the lands.]

text: Courtesy: This Holding also straightens at the start of other players' turns, but has -1GP on those turns. (Courtesy traits do not take effect if you went first.)
title: Ashigaru Farmland

flavor: When the elements are all in balance, present in equal measure, the land prospers.
designernotes: [Note: Water irrigates to other farms, making them more productive.]

text: This Holding has +1GP when it pays to Recruit a single Farm only, or when it pays for a single Sensei action only.
title: Bamboo Irrigation

flavor: "Conscripting farmers requires a light hand. Too many, and the harvests suffer. Too few, and they will talk of overthrowing their masters." - Bayushi Nitoshi
designernotes: [Notes: Some Peasants working in a field, it is a good harvest.]

text: Interrupt, :bow:: After the action Recruits an Ashigaru Personality, create a 0F/1C/0PH Ashigaru • Conscript Personality. Destroy this Holding.
title: Borderless Fields

flavor: "Fates and Fortunes may have their say, but ultimately it is preparation that wins battles." - Akodo Dairuko

text: Battle, :bow:: Give your target opposed Follower +1F, or +2F if it is attached to a Commander.
title: Combat Drill Field

flavor: Besieged castles are rarely assaulted, since, due to their layout, a direct assault is a dangerous affair. Instead, armies will surround a besieged castle and gradually starve the inhabitants. In these cases, a large storehouse can be the difference between victory and defeat.

text: You have +1 maximum hand size.
title: Daikura

flavor: Ji-Samurai willingly serve many masters, so many that they cannot tell them apart. They want only to be noticed, to prove their worth, that they might earn full-fledged retainer status and an estate of their own.

text: Battle: Transfer your target Follower from your target Personality to your other target Personality.
title: Garrison Hub

flavor: Without adequate warning, castle defenders are often forced to improvise.
designernotes: A crew working on reinforcing the walls of a castle.

text: Courtesy: Your Provinces have +1 strength. (Courtesy traits do not take effect if you went first.)
title: Hasty Defenses

flavor: The Heisha, meaning "soldier lodge," is the living quarters that a lord provides his garrison. It is always strategically placed, close enough to his quarters that they can protect him, but far enough away that they do not disturb him.

text: Open, :bow:: Put a target Follower in your discard pile into your hand.
title: Heisha

flavor: Some isolated villages are actually many smaller farms working in tandem. They often govern themselves, unconcerned with the conflicts of samurai and the world outside. As long as taxes are paid and the occasional Ashigaru conscripted, most samurai are content to leave them be.
designernotes: [Note: A big Farm that provides a lot of sustenance.]

text: After this Holding enters play, create a 0F/1C/0PH Ashigaru • Conscript Personality and straighten your Sensei.
title: Isolated Farmlands

flavor: "Feed our troops well, but for the sake of the Fortunes, don't spoil them! They must be fit to spill Scorpion blood soon." - Akodo Kano

text: This Holding has +1GP for each different title among your Barracks Holdings, other than Mess Hall, maximum +2GP.
title: Mess Hall

flavor: The lodging of officers is often better than that of lesser soldiers. But not by much.

text: Tireless Interrupt, :g*:: If you bowed this Holding to produce Gold while Recruiting a Commander, Equip a target Follower to him from your hand for 1 less Gold after he enters play.
title: Officer's Lodge

flavor: It is the largest dojo for many provinces, and one well known for its martial tournaments. Competitors travel from far and wide to compete with honor for the glory of their family and clan.
designernotes: [Notes: A Holding where unwanted crap is cycled out for good stuff.]

text: Open, :bow:: Draw a card. If you now have more cards in your hand than each other player, discard a card. Destroy this Holding.
title: Padis Dojo

flavor: "Let them come, then. If they dare to destroy this place, they will only serve to shame themselves and to exalt us in the eyes of their enemies."
designernotes: Big reinforced castle.

text:
(Fortifications attach to the Province from which they entered play.)
After this Holding is destroyed, gain 2 Honor.
title: Peaceful Retreat

flavor: "A violation of Imperial law, you say? An interesting position with interesting implications, Akodo-san. Let us examine your argument more closely."
designernotes: A partisan politician arguing on behalf of his lord.

text: After this Holding enters play, a target player gains or loses 1 Honor.
title: Rhetorician

flavor: Ashigaru who return to their farmlands are changed by the wars they've fought. They are wiser, stronger, more willful, and, most importantly, respected. They can protect their own lands. It is often better for samurai that such farmers die in battle.
designernotes: [Notes: Some farm that trains Ashigaru.]

text: Battle/Open: Straighten your target Ashigaru Follower.
title: Veteran's Farmland

flavor: Hidden away in the recesses of the Spine of the World Mountains, the impossibly ancient library at the City of Night waited for the Dragon.
designernotes: This is actually the City of Night, and the Dragon are searching through the remnants of a Library there, in search for answers for the three Seals.

text: Battle, :bow:: Straighten your target Spell. You may use its abilities a second time this turn, but they do not give Force bonuses to unopposed Personalities.
title: City of Night

flavor: "I do not care what it was! If it rears its head again, blast it off!"
designernotes: Art: Bayushi Dijuro commanding Scorpion forces from a wall. His crew is loading a wicked looking siege engine.

text:
You may take this Holding's actions during a battle at any battlefield where you control a Siege Personality.
Battle, :bow:: Ranged 2 Attack.
Interrupt, :bow:: Give the action's Ranged Attacks +2 strength.
title: Defensive Fortification

flavor: "You are weary, you say? How fortunate for you that the enemies of the Scorpion are also weary. Do it again! Ten more times!" - Bayushi Hisako
designernotes: [Art Note: A Dojo that teaches you how to keep on fighting even when you are exhausted.]

text:
You may Recruit this Holding as an Open.
After you Recruit this Holding, you may target and straighten a Duelist.
title: Dojo of the Dauntless

flavor: In times of great conflict, defenses built in haste are vastly superior to no defenses at all.
designernotes: A massive tower at a Scorpion castle, making sure that no one can sneak up on them.

text:
This Holding enters play unbowed if you control any Siege Personalities.
Open, :bow:: If you control any Personalities, gain 1 Honor.
title: Erected Watchtower

flavor: "There are places," the Dragon whispered, "where this realm is bound to the Heavens. If we can find them, we can stop the prophecy."
designernotes: This is actually Ki-Rin's Shrine, where the Dragon are looking for clues about the Three Seals.

text:
After a Kharmic action puts this Holding into a discard pile, draw a card and remove this Holding from the game.
This Holding has +1GP when it pays for a single Kharmic action only.
title: Ki-Rin's Shrine

flavor: The visions and prophecy offered by the Heavens warned that a terrible fate would come to pass, but a small group swore they would stop it at any cost.
designernotes: The big Isawa Library, we see the prophecy gang Asahina Hira, Kitsune Narako, Kitsu Kiyoko, and Agasha Kurou. In this set they are researching into Enomoto's writings to figure out what this prophecy is, what the seals are, etc.

text: Interrupt, :bow:: After the action Equips a Spell from your hand, draw a card. You may not use abilities on any Libraries of Kyuden Isawa again this turn.
title: Libraries of Kyuden Isawa

flavor: The dojo at Sunda Mizu Mura is the largest in Crab lands, and the finest veterans of the Crab armies go there to teach the next generation.
designernotes: [Art Note: The Sensei of a Dojo.]

text: This Holding enters play for 1 less Gold if another of your Dojos entered play this turn.
title: Master of Clear Water Dojo

flavor: Just as some samurai choose to serve the clan as advisors in their old age, some aged shugenja continue to work as librarians and scholars.
designernotes: The head of a Library, whatever he is called, working with other Libraries to share knowledge.

text: This Holding has +1GP when it pays to Recruit or Equip a single Library or Spell only.
title: Retired Scholar

flavor: "Crane poets like to say their bushi's blades strike so swiftly they cast no shadow. A typical exaggeration." - Ikoma Asa
designernotes: [Art Note: A fighting style which teaches you to repeat the same style again and again]

text: Battle/Open, :bow:: Target your Duelist who has not been targeted by a Shadowless Strike Dojo this turn. Your Duelist has +1F while opposed. After he or she enters a duel facing a Personality with higher Chi, give your Duelist +1C in the duel's resolution.
title: Shadowless Strike Dojo

flavor: Deep within the boundaries of the Shadowlands, there once stood a pure village immune to the Taint. Its history has been one of secrets and tragedy, but now it may play a role of great importance once again.
designernotes: This is acutally Shinsei's Last Hope, where the Dragon are searching for answers.

text: Battle, :bow:: Give a target enemy Follower or Personality -2F. If the target is Shadowlands and attacking, give it -4F instead and bow it if its Force is now 0.
title: Shinsei's Last Hope

flavor: Generations ago, the War of Spirits nearly tore the Empire apart. Some secrets of that time remain hidden within Rokugan.
designernotes: [Art Note: A Dojo which teaches you how to predict what comes next.]

text: After this Holding enters play from a Province, refill the Province face-up.
title: Spirit's Essence Dojo

flavor: Nestled deeply in a hidden ravine far inside the Shinomen Mori, the temple waited. It was a memory of a time before man, before even the Naga, and no one had disturbed it for untold thousands of years… until now.
designernotes: The third seal is deep within the hidden recesses of the Shinomen Mori, in a lost temple that was already ancient when the Naga were still active, concealed deep within a ravine where the sun never shines.

text: Interrupt, :bow:: Give one of the action's Fear effects +1 strength.
title: Temple of the First Seal

flavor: "What a pleasant place to rest! I wonder where these stairs go… Oh Fortunes, no! Aaaaagh!"
designernotes: [Art Note: This Hill is an actual Oni, eating an unsuspecting Samurai walking on it.

text:
After this Holding enters play, lose 3 Honor. This Holding enters play for 1 less Gold for each Shadowlands Follower and Personality you control. After you bow this Holding, lose 1 Honor.
Open, :bow:: Straighten your target Oni.
story: Thank you for your support over the years - Team Whiplash
title: The Feeding Hills

flavor: "A strange incident took place in the halls of the Ikoma last month. As a historian myself, I can only hope to someday chronicle the truth of it." - Otomo Hiroshi
designernotes: Another library, I guess.

text:
(Draw a card after you Recruit a Destined card.)
After you draw a card for bringing this Holding into play, if you then have four or more cards in your hand, discard a card.
title: The Ikoma Halls

flavor: "The Dragon are fond of strange gempukku customs. What does a poem show about one's martial skills?" - Ikoma Kiyomako
designernotes: [Art Note: A very prestigious Dojo.]

text: Open: Once per game, create and attach a +2F/+1C One-Handed • Sword • Weapon Item to your target Duelist.
title: The Iron Mountain School

flavor: The theft of a few obscure scrolls from Kyuden Miya was never explained. Few even noticed their absence.
designernotes: Kyuden Miya Library, we see the Scorpion infiltrating it, disguised as Mantis, to destroy knowledge of the seals.

text: Open, :bow:: Transfer your target Spell (in play) to your target Shugenja.
title: The Miya Records
